post_text: Great news for Roscommon High School from U.S. News & World Report's "Best High Schools" report!
shared_text:
USNEWS.COM
How Does Roscommon High School Rank Among America's Best High Schools?

Roscommon High School
April 21 at 7:55 AM ·

We received some awesome news on this snowy April morning. We have been named one of the top 50 high schools in the state by U.S. NEWS & WORLD REPORT. We are #50 overall; the only other northern MI schools ahead of us are Elk Rapids (#22) and Traverse City Central (#38)! So proud of all of our HS staff -- and all of those folks @ RES & RMS that helped get them to us! #celebrateRHS #BUCKPRIDE #GOBUCKS

https://www.usnews.com/education/best-high-schools/michigan/districts/roscommon-area-public-schools/roscommon-high-school-9957

post_text:
During this time of closure, RAPS district and families must work together to educate our children. RAPS has provided a Continuity of Learning Plan with our virtual and home learning opportunities along with staff "office hours" and educational learning at home web links .We are looking forward to welcoming you back 'virtually'!
Learn more at: https://www.rapsk12.net/our-district/educational-resources/

Transitioning to remote learning will require cooperation, patience, flexibility, and perseverance from families and educators. Together, we can make this a positive learning experience for our students!

Educational Resources
text:
During this time of closure, RAPS district and families must work together to educate our children. RAPS has provided a Continuity of Learning Plan with our virtual and home learning opportunities along with staff "office hours" and educational learning at home web links .We are looking forward to welcoming you back 'virtually'!
Learn more at: https://www.rapsk12.net/our-district/educational-resources/

Transitioning to remote learning will require cooperation, patience, flexibility, and perseverance from families and educators. Together, we can make this a positive learning experience for our students!

post_text: Great news! Helped a lot of needy families!
shared_text:
Roscommon High School
March 19 at 3:49 PM ·

Today, our kitchen staff prepped and packaged 4312 meals for our students. Each student received 4 breakfasts and 4 lunches These were delivered today by our bus team and parapro team. We will continue delivering again on Mon, 3/23. Thank you to everyone who is helping make this happen. #proudtobeaBUCK

Roscommon High School
March 18 at 4:47 PM ·

*PLEASE SHARE!

Here the all in food resource event that we have in the next few weeks in Roscommon County:

Wed 3/18
Monthly Commodity Supplemental Food Program 60+ (CSFP aka Senior Boxes)
-St. Helen Senior Center 9-10am
10493 E Airport Rd, St Helen
-Roscommon Community Center (Senior Ctr) 10:30-11:30am
510 South St, Roscommon

Thur 3/19
Monthly Commodity Supplemental Food Program 60+ (CSFP aka Senior Boxes)
-Houghton Lake Community Center (Senior Ctr) 9:30-10:30am
2625 S Townline Rd, Houghton Lake

Fri 3/20
Mobile Truck at Roscommon County Food Pantry 11am-gone
725 Loxley St, Houghton Lake

Mon 3/23
Temporary Emergency Food Assistance Program (TEFAP Quarterly)
3 sites in Roscommon Cty 10-11:30am
-Houghton Lake Community Center (Senior Ctr)
2625 S Townline Rd, Houghton Lake
-Richfield Township Hall
9181 N. Keno Road, St. Helen
-Roscommon Community Center (Senior Ctr) 10:30-11:30am
510 South St, Roscommon

Thurs 3/26
Mobile Truck at Roscommon Area Schools Bus Garage 10am-gone
301 W. Sunset Dr, Roscommon (next to Elementary School)

post_text: Great job!
shared_text:
Roscommon High School
March 17 at 4:39 PM ·

Just when you think we can't do better...we do! Our kitchen, parapro, and bus team delivered 470 meals to kids throughout our district. Amazing job, everyone!! #proudtobeaBUCK

For those waiting for meals, know that the buses roll at 11:00 am. We hit every stop in the district and have food for kids under 18 (for as many as live in the household) regardless of what school you attend. Look for the big yellow buses...we'll get to ya!

post_text:
Breakfast with Santa is almost here! Come join your family and friends on December 7, 2019 for Breakfast with Santa. This event, put on by the Roscommon High School Marching Bucks, takes place at the Roscommon High School from 8:30 am to 11:30 am. Breakfast, make and take ornaments, face painting, balloon animals, kids games, prizes and, of course, Ole Saint Nick!! We look forward to seeing you there!
Admission ages 3 and up =$5 each, family of 5 or more = $20 total
shared_text:

post_text:
Employment Opportunities: Roscommon Area Public Schools needs substitutes for the 2019-2020 school year. All areas are needed. Very flexible! Choose your work days, choose which buildings to work, choose the area you wish to work (depending on qualifications). RAPS needs teacher subs, secretarial, custodial and paraprofessionals.
Apply now for the new school year! Interested applicants can complete an application through EDUStaff Services at https://www.edustaff.org/
text:
Employment Opportunities: Roscommon Area Public Schools needs substitutes for the 2019-2020 school year. All areas are needed. Very flexible! Choose your work days, choose which buildings to work, choose the area you wish to work (depending on qualifications). RAPS needs teacher subs, secretarial, custodial and paraprofessionals.
Apply now for the new school year! Interested applicants can complete an application through EDUStaff Services at https://www.edustaff.org/

post_text: Congratulations students and staff of Roscommon High School! Great work!
shared_text:
Roscommon High School
January 22, 2019 at 10:21 PM ·

We received some great news today from the Mackinaw Center for Public Policy. They formally released their annual study on the best schools in Michigan, and they found us to be one of the Top 25 District-run High Schools! We are ranked 24th overall (they rank the top 25). This ranking is for all HS in the state regardless of enrollment.

The Center uses free and reduced lunch numbers as well as standardized test scores to figure out each school's rank. We scored 111.19 overall with a percent rank of 93.18, and a letter grade of A.

SO PROUD OF OUR STUDENTS AND STAFF FOR ALL OF YOUR HARD WORK! #celebrateRHS #proudBUCK #greatdaytobeaBUCK
text:

post_text: Great job, we have a very generous RHS family!
shared_text:
Roscommon High School
December 16, 2018 at 11:15 PM ·

Thank you to everyone who donated to this year's annual food drive. The amount of food that was brought in was beyond words. The generosity of the RHS students, staff, and community is overwhelming. We were able to box up over 100+ boxes of food for distribution. We are extending the food drive through this week as long as boxes are available (please call RHS between 8:00-3:00 to check on availability).

Thank you to Jesse Waterman and the RHS Student Council for organizing and boxing up the food this weekend. Thank you to Cathy Erickson and the RAPS BOE for the Family Fare gift cards to go along with the food boxes.
text:
Great job, we have a very generous RHS family!

Roscommon High School
December 16, 2018 at 11:15 PM ·

Thank you to everyone who donated to this year's annual food drive. The amount of food that was brought in was beyond words. The generosity of the RHS students, staff, and community is overwhelming. We were able to box up over 100+ boxes of food for distribution. We are extending the food drive through this week as long as boxes are available (please call RHS between 8:00-3:00 to check on availability).

Thank you to Jesse Waterman and the RHS Student Council for organizing and boxing up the food this weekend. Thank you to Cathy Erickson and the RAPS BOE for the Family Fare gift cards to go along with the food boxes.

post_text:
Earlier this year a handful of students in Mrs. Waterman's Art Class at Roscommon High School completed something called the Memory Project. It is an organization that finds kids that have been affected by something beyond their control e.g. hurricane, natural disaster, foster care etc. They then have artists from around the world paint portraits of the kids, which are later hand delivered to them.

The students worked on the project for kids affected by Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico. The student's portraits were hand delivered (along with art supplies) by the folks from the Memory Project. Here is a video of the delivery. We are so proud of these students!

https://youtu.be/mj8ELKMcpSs
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
Roscommon High School- Ms. Waterman's Art Class Memory Project
text:
Earlier this year a handful of students in Mrs. Waterman's Art Class at Roscommon High School completed something called the Memory Project. It is an organization that finds kids that have been affected by something beyond their control e.g. hurricane, natural disaster, foster care etc. They then have artists from around the world paint portraits of the kids, which are later hand delivered to them.

The students worked on the project for kids affected by Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico. The student's portraits were hand delivered (along with art supplies) by the folks from the Memory Project. Here is a video of the delivery. We are so proud of these students!

shared_text:
MYRCCF.ORG
RCCF Announces New Fund | Roscommon County Community Foundation

Roscommon County Community Foundation
August 4, 2016 at 10:26 AM ·

The Roscommon County Community Foundation (RCCF) is pleased to announce a new Fund which has been established by the family and friends of Char Goddard, the Char Goddard Memorial Scholarship Fund. The endowed fund will be used to provide scholarship(s) to graduating seniors from Roscommon High School. Preference will be given to students planning to study culinary arts or business management.

To read more about this scholarship, or to make a donation, visit the link below.
text:
MYRCCF.ORG
RCCF Announces New Fund | Roscommon County Community Foundation

Roscommon County Community Foundation
August 4, 2016 at 10:26 AM ·

The Roscommon County Community Foundation (RCCF) is pleased to announce a new Fund which has been established by the family and friends of Char Goddard, the Char Goddard Memorial Scholarship Fund. The endowed fund will be used to provide scholarship(s) to graduating seniors from Roscommon High School. Preference will be given to students planning to study culinary arts or business management.

To read more about this scholarship, or to make a donation, visit the link below.

post_text:
RNYSA Soccer
The spring season of Roscommon Youth Soccer is coming up soon. If you would like to sign your child (ages 4-12 as of August 1, 2014) up for one of our leagues, registrations and payments must be in by March 23 to guarantee a spot on a team. Late registrations will be accepted, but players will be placed on a waiting list and only placed if there is room. If you are interested, please visit our Facebook page – Roscommon North Soccer Association – or our webpage – www.RNYSA.org to download the registration form.

post_text:
Lear Corporation Donation

RHS would like to thank the Lear Corporation of Roscommon for donating personal protection equipment (safety items) and tools to the RHS Industrial Arts program. The donation will help protect and enhance our students trades experience.

Roscommon High School
November 11, 2014 at 11:16 PM ·

VB Update --

The girls rolled to a Regional Semifinal win tonight over Alcona (25-13, 25-8, 25-3). Great effort tonight, ladies! Next up is TC St. Francis in Regional Finals on Thursday, Nov 13 @ 7:00 pm @ Johannesburg-Lewiston. #GOBUCKS
